summary: A letter from Judge Richard M. Berman to the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein, referencing an unexplained prior incident involving Epstein at the MCC on or about July 23, 2019, and questioning the scope of ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Author of the letter, expressing that Epstein's death is a tragedy and questioning whether investigations will include the prior incident at MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose death is described as a tragedy; the letter references an unexplained incident involving him at MCC on or about July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein, copied on the letter.

connections.description: Weinberg is identified as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the letter.
Judge Berman was presiding over Epstein's case and is corresponding about his death and prior incident.

keyFacts: Judge Richard M. Berman describes Jeffrey Epstein's death as 'a tragedy to everyone involved in his case.'
The letter references an unexplained incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on or about July 23, 2019.
Judge Berman questions whether ongoing investigations will include the July 23, 2019 incident, noting it has never been definitively explained what the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) concluded about it.
Martin Weinberg is identified as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein and is copied on the correspondence.
